Reviews.Title: “Amazing Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ruckus87
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here for 5 nights and found this to be great boutique hotel with excellent service staff and amenities. The location is practically in walking distance of all the major sites and local neighborhood has many great shops and scenes to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely !”
Reviews.Author: ThamyresVM
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff, amazing rooms equipped with two apple computers & a nespresso machine. The only problem I would have to point out is the shower: It's inside the bathtub, therefore you either close the plastic curtains and have a claustrophobic experience or you leave a little bit of it open and tolerate a very wet floor. Beware vegans & lactose intolerant friends: Not many options for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great design, but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: M0nsieurHul0t
Reviews.Content: Ok, this hotel looks great, the interior decorating is very nice, but it is really really too expensive for what's offered. We stayed in a Suite -which cost me an arm and a leg- and it was quite small, we had to watch out not to bump into each other. The bathroom could just merely fit the bathtub and one washbasin. The so-called fireplace that is advertised on the website does not function... Breakfast is very sober (unless of course you pay for a lot of extras). There are better hotels in Paris, for half this price.

Reviews.Title: “A small gem in a big city”
Reviews.Author: AndrewinDublin
Reviews.Content: This really could be a one word review, with the word being "Wow". I booked La Belle Juliette as a surprise for my wife's 40th birthday. Even before we arrived we had an inkling of how good they would be when I contacted the hotel to ask if they could book some restaurant's for us in advance. They complied without hesitation. When we arrived we found that the front of house staff were fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble, from advising us where to have a quick bite to eat, which was the best way to walk to a certain location, or just wishing my wife a happy birthday. They took an interest in us and our stay and that, for us, is what makes a hotel enjoyable. The other part, naturally, is the room. I had booked the Junior Suite ( Well it was her 40th) and this was a beautiful room, with a fantastically huge bed, huge bath, 2 Mac pc's and a Nespresso machine which i found a daily use for. Overall the room was tip top. We stayed for 3 nights and each one of them was a blast and it started and ended with the hotel and its staff. A better, more wonderful hotel staff we have not found anywhere. I cannot rate this hotel highly enough, It's a small treasure with only the 30 odd rooms but for that you are made to feel like you are the only people staying there and you cannot put a price on that. As the French probably don't say, Fantastique!!.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Gem Of A Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 555NewYorker
Reviews.Content: Stayed at La Belle Juliette for 4 nights. It is a small hotel located in the St. Germain district, which is not very toursity but very central (walking distance to Musee d'Orsay, for instance) and close to a couple of Metro stations, Bon Marche, as well as a host of cozy, nice neighborhood restaurants. The hotel itself was lovely - room was beautifully decorated, bathroom had the BEST shower ever (how rare is that, in a hotel anywhere?), comfortable, firm bed, and the staff very helpful. While room is small, as is usually the case in Europe, the hotel is esthetically very pleasing without any attitude (which usually accompanies anywhere 'stylish'). Would highly recommend it to anyone who wants to pretend like they live in the neighborhood vs. being a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: Johnfishwick-stape
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Belle Juliette we were impressed. The hotel was immaculate and the decor was elegant and as good as the photographs on the website. What makes the hotel extra special was the staff. They were extremely friendly and helpful, although we tried to speak a bit of French the staff spoke perfect English and were very informative. Nothing seemed like too much trouble. Our overall stay was fabulous and I would whole heartedly recommend the Belle Juliette to anyone wanting to visit Paris. It made my birthday extra special. The only thing which could have made the stay better would be tea and coffee making facilities in the room, that being said this did not impact on our stay negatively. A thoroughly good time and perfect for any occasion, for all the romantics out there it is a dream come true!

Reviews.Title: “A little jewel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: amkdt
Reviews.Content: Beautiful small boutique hotel, where every detail is thought through. Very nicely decorated rooms, ultra comfortable (albeit with a little bit of noise from the road - but none from the other rooms!), with very nice bathrooms. We used the small but exquisite spa: so beautiful, peaceful and relaxing! The breakfast was delicious and served in a very nice room.The whole place is very chic and elegant, but not at all snobby. The atmosphere is very relaxed: it felt like a home, rather than a hotel. The service was amazing: very personalised and efficient. Perfect location too: in a quiet residential area, but with lots of cafes and restaurants and only 5 minutes walk from St Germain. We will definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Hotel, Great location, small but great rooms, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: mamitanl
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in this lovely hotel. Staff is friendly and helpful, rooms are beautiful but small with quite hard matresses, toilet is tiny! Bathrooms could be great, aside from loud banging door, ONE tiny soap bar, big shower head that needs unclogging. Lastly, for a **** hotel, lift is extremely slow! but.... we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Romance & etc.”
Reviews.Author: SugarPooh
Reviews.Content: this boutique hotel strikes smooth harmony between character with romantic flair! our room is exquiste and beautifully furnished. service excellent and location can't be beat and decor to boot....loved the mac computer/tv and top-of-the line coffee maker in the room. bed and fine linens to our likings! our only annoyance is the room layout. space a tad tight for 2 regular size adults to walk or pass each other between bed and closet. next time we'll get the bigger suite!!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay in a perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: georgmac
Reviews.Content: Travelling a lot in Europe, especially, I will always remember this boutique hotel as an important new "standard" on excellent level! The service at the reception, first (thanks Carlos and all the nice collegues), the amenities, the interiors and internal architecture, the room... more then polite, all warm, nice and beautyful in all its parts! The location is central enough for all... for sure, the next stay will be at the La Belle Juliette again! The inspired name is a guarantee for harmony and relaxing stay!

Reviews.Title: “Paris Feb 2012”
Reviews.Author: Lisa K
Reviews.Content: Great boutique feel to the hotel, friendly staff and lovely deco. Great location!!

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique hotel in great location with well meaning staff let down by several key mistakes”
Reviews.Author: zanaida
Reviews.Content: This review is actually difficult to write as I so much wanted to love La Belle Juliette and give this gorgeous little boutique hotel the 5/5 most others here feel it deserves. This sentiment is no doubt helped by the fact that the very friendly front-desk staff gave us an upgrade upon learning that this was our honeymoon. We were overjoyed as you can imagine! While I'm on the positives - the hotel, it's well sized public lounge areas and our junior suite are all beautifully decorated in a tasteful mix of modern & period pieces of furniture. Each floor is dedicated to one of the places 'Juliette' enjoyed traveling to with ours done in an Italian theme. The front desk informed us the hotel was only a year old and you can tell - everything is clean and unworn. Our room was small by standard suite standards but largish by Parisian ones with a small sitting room, a bedroom and a bathroom with a very nice bath and shower head (unusual for Europe) and separate toilet. We had not one but two iMacs which act as both a computer and TV - we didn't use either as we had all of Paris to explore but made liberal use of the free wifi. The room had no mini bar but the complimentary bottle of still and sparkling each day was welcome and I spotted a coffee machine with capsules that remained untouched but a nice idea.  I've referred several time to the front desk staff - these guys were good!! Very helpful, warm and friendly at all times and if they were all we were rating the hotel on I would be giving it ten out of five. No task was too daunting and a highlight was when they discovered a restaurant we had wanted to visit was shut down. They tirelessly tracked the chef to a new venue - investigated and discovered the food was of the same style as the old one and took the liberty of booking us a table. I love that kind of proactivity!  The location of the hotel was a major positive for me but I realize not all people may not be my way inclined. It is on an adorable Parisian street with many little shops, bistros, etc but feels more local than touristy. It is a short walk from any of the main sights but I feel St Germain-de-pres is a sight in itself to be honest. My best discovery was Le Bon Marche just around the corner - we made liberal use of both the gourmet supermarket (mmmm cheese, ham and crusty bread galore!) and the oh so Parisienne department store. Now onto the negatives. The breakfast which is not included leaves a lot to be desired. I could get past the lack of buffet and rather limited menu if there weren't so many mistakes but we gave up after three tries and purchased our own breakfast at the local boulangerie to eat in our room on the fourth day. The service was strikingly unfriendly when contrasted with that of the front desk. On the first morning the coffee was ice cold, the bread basket that was ordered never arrived, and more concerning was the number of other guests we heard complaining loudly about their experience. The second morning I ordered the plate of Italian meats and cheeses which arrived sans cheese. When I pointed it out one waiter informed me it didn't come with cheese while the other said it did and proceeded to inform me the chef was asleep so they couldn't confirm what went on the dish. Other experiences included orange juice running out (there was a supermarket and fruit shop virtually next door!), a dish arriving with two kinds of cheese one day and only one the next, coffee without milk when milk wad requested and so on.  Inside the hotel bedroom I'm sorry to say the mattresses were much too soft - if you have a bad back I would recommend you avoid. The bedcovers were sheets with wool blankets (unfortunately wool makes me itch) and the wardrobe posed a problem with the doors not having enough room to open due to a lack of space. Lighting which I see is attempting to be atmospheric is a problem - specifically the lack thereof. And I know it's the thought that counts but when we arrived in our suite, overjoyed at our recent upgrade we were made even happier by the rose petals scattered on our beds only to be somewhat disappointed by a note offering us 'this' bottle of champagne with their compliments but no actual champagne to be found!  In hindsight I think that with this hotel ranked 6 out of 1500+ on Trip Advisor our expectations were high and were probably judging more harshly than we might have done but when balancing the room cost with the TA rating and our other Paris and Western Europe hotel experiences I think this is still a fair review.

Reviews.Title: “Very memorable!”
Reviews.Author: dancing_luv
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Belle Juliette for 8 nights recently. We had a wonderful stay, especially being our first time in Paris. This hotel is situated in what appears to be a very nice & affluent area of Paris. Lots of great cafes, restaurants & patisseries close by & conveniently located near 3 metro stations. There's also a wonderful department store (Bon Marche) near the hotel that would rival the busy touristy Galeries Lafayette. Although the rooms are small, the hotel is very charming. We stayed in a superior room & it was very comfortable. The bathrooms are beautifully presented, though the lighting is a little dark for make-up application! I found the cleanliness outstanding. The staff are also very attentive & always helpful. They definitely were a standout to us. We loved our time here & we definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and very girly”
Reviews.Author: Jennieee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well-situated on a lovely street, with great local shops, bistros and patisseries. Our room was slightly on the small side but very pretty, with everything we needed and more. The staff were very helpful and accommodating, and we enjoyed a glass of champagne in their stunning lounge area. Would definitely recommend, though it is very girly!

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite!”
Reviews.Author: Little Leon
Reviews.Content: If you are planning to see Paris, do not stay at La Belle Juliette because you will be tempted to stay in your room and never leave this lovely hotel!!! We reserved the smallest room and it was perfect; so cozy and sumptuous and divine!!! The staff is warm, gracious and professional; always willing to help. It was truly one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Sweetbox”
Reviews.Author: Fufa S
Reviews.Content: We spent a loveliest girly Christmas week in Paris. It all was inoubliable! The best thing about the hotel is its location and the "Who is Juliette?" story. So, if you forgot your book, there is very nice story to read in each room, equipped with an amazing iMac. Everything about the hotel was perfect. We felt safe (comparing to Hotel Lebron, but that's another story)! Here are 2 pleasant and memorable things about the hotel: 1. When we moved in, Carlos (front desk guy) suggested that we let them keep our suitcases till departure. That was the first case in my traveller practice! I was sooo grateful, for we had three suitcases. 2. Oh, that was one of the greatest surprises in my life! My boyfriend adores Nutella, and I always bring him one or two from every trip. This time I wanted to find a place to buy the BIG FAT 5kg jar, one they have in creperie kiosks (it's Christmas time, isn't it?). So, I asked the concierge, but was told to look for a big supermarkets. Then, my friend encouraged me to ask a woman from the Christmas bazaar down the Tour Eiffel, and she sold us one! With a little help from my friends :) Then, when I was back in my room, with 5kg bag in my hand, I was simply shocked - I saw the same BIG FAT 5kg Nutella jar near to iMac!!! And, I should say, there wasn't any kind of note left. And one more thing! Everyone of the staff is nice and good looking. Thank you, guys. Thank you very much!

Reviews.Title: “"home away from home"...”
Reviews.Author: MICHALVS
Reviews.Content: best staff,beautiful desine,good location !!! WE LOVED IT !!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel / Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: EireGirlSF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this beautiful boutique hotel! Room: We stayed in a “superior room with shower”. Décor was absolutely gorgeous. I would say the bedroom space was standard for a European hotel and the bathroom was spacious with a fabulous shower. Hotel had free wi-fi throughout. Service: The reception staff were extremely pleasant and attentive throughout our stay, particularly Carlos. It was raining when we were leaving and, when the taxi pulled up to take us to the station, Carlos grabbed our bags and proceeded to run out into the rain to put them in the taxi - all with a smile. We had wine and snacks in the restaurant on two occasions and the service was simply average both times. So, 5 stars for the reception staff and 3 stars for the restaurant staff. Location: As others have noted it's a lovely neighborhood with many shops and restaurants. We ate at "Les Garcons " one night, which seemed to be full of locals rather than tourists, and the waitress who served us was very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Danish H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took the Romantic room for our stay in Paris. The location is great with nice antique book stores, great restaurants and pastry shops, 2 supermarkets nearby and 5 subway stations for you to choose to board. Front desk receptionist, Mr Carlos was very attentive and polite. Interior decoration is classy and modern french. For those who complained Paris' hotel lifts are too small, you won't be disappointed. The lift is huge, which I personally feel lose the essence of a french-like feel. Upon entering our room, white rose petals were scattered on the floor leading to the bed. Definitely romantic! A very personal touch with a hand written note welcoming us from the manager of the hotel. Room is spacious, tastefully decorated, romantic ambience, and the bath tub is the best, with rain shower and facing the window. Bed is supremely plush and comfortable. The bedding is egyptian cotton so it feels so soft on your skin. A nespresso machine with complimentary nespresso in the room. OMG! Internet, computer and wi-fi are all available and the internet speed was ultra fast. We felt like this is a home, which we do not want to get out. Did not try their breakfast as we went and explore different cafés every morning. This is not a touristy type of place and we were the only asians dining around during our stay. Great neighborhood and quiet at night even during the weekend. Overall, well worth my Euro330/night stay in this hotel and will be staying here again for our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely ambience”
Reviews.Author: Kelly V
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully decorated. Its a really cosy boutique hotel in a great location. Some great restaurants and a lovely tea shop just up the road. Central enough to walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, very small Rooms !”
Reviews.Author: Amelia L
Reviews.Content: I feel compelled to write this review as we based our entire decison on other reviews from this site. The hotel was in a great location, but we found the staff not all that friendly, when we arrived we were not shown to our room, which Is the first time I have experienced this, I believe in a hotel where you are paying 260 per night this sort of minimal service is a neccessity especailly when the room is FULL of quirks and tricky gagety light switches etc, we spent ages trying to work the coffee machine and the TV and each time we switched on the bath we got soaked by the shower as the switches are so close together. We then went to the spa to be greeted by a very unfriendly member of staff, who made us feel very unwelcome. We were also never shown the bar area or breakfast area of the hotel - again it would have been so easy for someone from the front desk to show us this upon arrival. The rooms were VERY small which we expected from Paris but was still quite surprised. The decor was great and very imaginative. There was no mini bar which again was a huge let down as the only way you could have a drink is by ordering one from the bar which isnt always what you want to do especailly on a romantic weekend! we also found the extra charge of 20 euros for breakfast a lot especailly when the variety was pretty poor. I did love the hotel but would recommend it other than the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Belle”
Reviews.Author: Jim D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December 2011 for my wife's birthday. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the decor quirky and designy without being pretentious. It was easy to get around Paris and the immediate area had a nice boho feel to it. Felt pampered and spoiled, and would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent Left Bank boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: SparkyNeb
Reviews.Content: Great service and high quality gut renovation (opened in Jan 2010). Very attractive design and a nice location (although about a 10 minute walk from the river). Free wifi and bottled water. Expensive (but good) breakfast (not included). TV's are large Apple computers--unique and useful. Nicely decorated--solid 4 star. Well priced for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “seriously a special place in Paris..”
Reviews.Author: tortorelli m
Reviews.Content: the best hotel I have ever stayed in, with a great location, lovely furnishings and more the perfect service..

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: DrZee1
Reviews.Content: We took a few days annual leave away from the kids. Paris is easy - no flights. Arrived at the Hotel La Belle juliette. Initial thoughts were lovely area , quite a modest frontage. As we arrived were met by lovely staff inc Carlos. The staff were warm and professional. They were polite, well presented, spoke good english and had our room ready. The hotel is beautifully interiorally designed. The clours are magnificant but its not overly modern to make you feel ill at ease. The room was smallish though reasonably sized compared to other Paris hotels weve stayed at. The room decor was immaculate as was the bathroom and separate toilet. There was no coffee maker though I think you do get this in a suite. Ours was a superior room with bath. Only critism was the shower curtain on the bath was a bit cheap looking. However the bathroom was again beautifully designed and had the best shower my wife had ever come across. We had a cocktail in the liovely lounge before going out. The interior design in the public areas is out of this world. My cocktail was good aswell served with some tiny tasty tomato bread snacks. The music was very relaxing. The concierge seemed professional with respect to booking tables and restaurants, taxis etc. Their recommendation of a new restaurant on the same street Lachetta wasn't great though nice atmostphere and ambience. We ate another night at a restaurant from Time out LA CERISAIE - 70, boulevard Edgar Quinet 75014 PARIS which was superb!! The spa is small but again amazingly designed and very relaxing. Can't fault the place. Overall this hotel was one of the best I have stayed in. I would recommend it strongly. If the hotel wants to improve I would say a Nespresso machine in all rooms not just the deluxe and perhaps a arrival treat. We are planning on returning again next year sans enfants.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the great reviews!”
Reviews.Author: PCR-USA
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at La Belle Juliette for a week this past October and loved every single second. I found out about this boutique hotel from TripAdvisor and booked it solely on the great reviews. It did not disappoint in any way! It was cozy and charming, and we felt like we had our very own chic Parisian apartment! The location is great - close to 2-3 Metro stops, and on a charming street which offered lots of great shopping and dining options. The room was immaculate, beautiful, stylish and very comfortable in every way (bed/bath awesome, and the iMac desktop with free WiFi was so handy to check emails and watch news.) Above all, the staff was wonderful. Friendly and helpful, they went above and beyond to make us feel truly welcome. A fantastic Paris hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fishskis
Reviews.Content: I Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this beautifully designed new boutique hotel. The hotel is modern and whimsical. The rooms are typically petite Paris Left Bank size, but they are thoughtfully designed. The bathrooms are great, with the multi head shower being as functionally great a shower as I have ever experienced. The bedding, towels, robes and amenities are all first class. The tv and in-room computer are beautifully engineered and technologically integrated nicely. The young staff is good, and the hotel is generally managed very well. The location is very good, close to Bon Marche and Luxembourg Gardens, though it is fairly far from the Seine, and a bit of a walk to the more lively areas (like Rue de Buci) of St. Germain. This is a great option for anyone looking for a cool modern luxury boutique hotel in the 6th.

Reviews.Title: “best holiday ever!”
Reviews.Author: Jonny6767
Reviews.Content: this hotel was amazing, start to finish. although we got completely lost on the way there due to our inability to write down an address after a heavy wedding the day before, everything after that was perfect. the staff were unobtrusive, which is a major plus for us. the iMac in the bedroom was awesome; having the internet in room and at a high speed (i'm a geek for a fast computer) meant we could listen to music while we chilled out and ate cheese and the like. the beds are awesome, the shower could knock you over. yes yes these are the things we look for in a hotel. it's in between three metro stops, and the area and rue du cherche midi is full of cafes and restaurants, you barely have to walk 20 paces and you could be in several. the take out sushi shop just up the street saved us on numerous occasion. and there's a supermarket just on the street behind. if i was being fussy i'd say the room was a bit small, but you're in paris, if you're in your room for anything other than sleep, you're probably missing the point of being there anyway. however the bed was huge, so my perspective might have got lost. best hotel we've stayed in yet. helped us on the way to the best 5 day break we've had. cheers!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice!”
Reviews.Author: pau2x
Reviews.Content: This St. Germain boutique hotel was the perfect choice for our second visit to Paris. We knew we wanted somewhere relaxing, clean, close to cafe's, shops and tourist spots. LBJ was a dream from the moment we walked into our romantic, little room (rose petals on the bed to welcome us!) to the last day of our trip. The front staff (Dany, Jean Baptiste, Guillame and others) were so welcoming and helpful. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with charming design”
Reviews.Author: Alyona S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is Excellent with charming design, absolutely unique romantique atmosphere, located in very "Parisien" district - very close to Metropolitan, Bon Marche, Luxemburg garden and Saint-Sulpice. I would recommend this hotel to people waiting for something special, looking for realy good services and who want just to enjoy Paris!

Reviews.Title: “great stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: tammy w
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a couple visiting Paris. On a quiet street, but close enough to all the sites without all the touristy chaos. We loved exploring the neighborhood with many great cafes, patisseries, and great little shops. Close to a couple of metro stops so you can get anywhere in the city without much trouble but we loved to walk and take in the charm of Paris! When planning our trip it was difficult to decipher the best areas and overwhelming number of hotel choices, but we were extremely happy with our choice and would highly recommend it to others. The service was good and all of the staff knew enough english to help with our needs and lack of french. You won't go wrong if you choose the La belle Juliette!

Reviews.Title: “A joyful Parisian experience”
Reviews.Author: Sarah M
Reviews.Content: This was like a second honeymoon for us and the moment we stepped foot through the doors of the hotel we felt relaxed and warmly welcomed. Initially overwhelmed by choice of accommodation in Paris, having not returned for quite sometime, we were extremely happy with our final choice. Hotel reception also made dinner reservations for us in advance which was a great help. Our deluxe room ('romantic' package) was ready upon our arrival and the bath was perfect to wash away a 21 hour flight, followed by a cocktail in the bar. All reception staff warmly welcomed us each time we returned or left the hotel. The hotel bar is a tranquil setting especially after a day of exploring Paris. Plenty to see, eat and do in the area it was conveniently located for us (with locals not tourists filling the streets) especially as we did most of our touring on foot. The spa was also a great escape. We would definitely return to Hotel La Belle Juliette. Thank you to Jean-Baptiste for all his assistance.

Reviews.Title: “ahhhmazing.”
Reviews.Author: Heather G
Reviews.Content: we'd been saving and planning our honeymoon for what seemed like forever! it was our very first time in Paris, and everything about our stay at Le Belle Juliette was perfect. our room was ready when we arrived early and was sprinkled with a handwritten note, champagne & rose petals. the room: beautiful, comfortable and so parisian. we loved the imac/tv and kept our window open to the street below almost the entire time. it's one of the most gorgeous hotels i've had the pleasure of staying in. we loved st. germain des pres and spent lots of time in the neighborhood. it's so charming and is home to some of the best places & cafes in the entire city. it's quiet, safe and practical to get around the city. the staff was so polite, very helpful and fun. we've already reccommended the hotel to friends and family and are hoping to visit Paris again in the near future. we'll defintely stay here again. we love, love, loved it. thank you La Belle Juliette so much, for truly making our honeymoon unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Laurence W
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Paris - and we spent time sourcing the right hotel for us. La Belle Juliette was definitely it. Elegent, quiet (in a quiet street - but one with several cafes and restaurants if you don't wish to go far for a bite to eat), and with very friendly and attentive staff. (They coped politely with our poor French and then engaged us with excellent English!) We tend to be walkers and metro-users, not taxi-riders - and the location was great for us. We weren't wanting to rush around - so meandering towards the Seine via St Sulpice and Jardin du Luxembourg was perfect. You could get a feel for this refined area of the city and not worry about heavy traffic. La Belle Juliette only opened at the beginning of 2011 (the owners already have three other small Paris hotels in their group) and everything about it felt fresh and carefully thought through. Knowing that Paris hotel rooms can be small, we did splash out on a suite this time - and we appreciated the extra space. But, to be honest, we're pretty sure we'd be happy with any one of Le BJ's classily designed rooms. Wonderful. We're already planning our return.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, boutique experience”
Reviews.Author: ecl28
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely a unique experience in regard to its design and interesting quirks. Yes, it is no where near to the size of hotels in the US, but I feel that what it lacks in square footage it makes up for in quality in charm. We had a lovely shower - clean, relaxing, and tons of shower heads. The bed was comfortable, our room was spotlessly clean, and the computer and free internet in the room was a very nice touch. I would give it 5 stars except for two issues we had with the front desk. One was a wake up call we requested that never came. From a 4 star hotel, a basic request like this should be honored. Secondly, one of the concierges at the front desk went online to help up buy Eiffel Tower tickets and charged 4 to our credit card instead of 2 as we had asked. Instead of the hotel offering to pay for the extra two or a glass of wine in their cafe, he told us to try to hawk them at the Eiffel Tower. I realize it was an accident, but that is not the best customer service. Overall, I enjoyed this hotel and its cozy neighborhood. There are some great restaurants and patisseries in the area and we fully enjoyed our stay. I would definitely consider La Belle Juliet again on a return trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: GMFLondon
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect - welcome, service, room, breakfast and the best internet we have had - so easy to access and it was not an extra! The room was small but had a good sized bathroom with separate toilet and the furniture was cleverly designed to get in everything that was needed. We love the area - so many good restaurants, shops, galleries nearby and the river and Musee D'orsay just a walk away. We would highly recommend La Belle Juliette.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous Place !”
Reviews.Author: FlavioFukumoto
Reviews.Content: Charming place, very helpful staff, very nice decoration and environment, clean and well designed bedroom. In addition to all, the iMacs in the rooms are very helpful, you can access internet without an additional charge, and you can watch your homeland TV channel through the web-access ...

Reviews.Title: “The perfect boutique Chic French experience”
Reviews.Author: Nish01
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we had wanted it to be. After staying in London in yet another nice chain hotel, we found Belle Juliette a breath of fresh air. Firstly the location is amazing none touristy and so very French with excellent shopping and dining in every direction walking from the hotel. I had been prepared for the "small" hotel rooms of Paris but was pleasantly surprised at our superior room with separate shower. The hotel has used all available space very well, we even had a separate bathroom (which was so much bigger than expected) from the toilet. Yes there is no escaping the fact that compared to other cities the rooms are small be what they my lack in space they make up for in beautiful decor and style. It felt like the new French and not the tired out dated rooms most French hotels are decorated in. The IMac computer in each room that is fully integrated in to the TV just sets this hotel apart, was perfect for us to stay in touch or do some research on. Very smart idea guys. And for the staff, reception couldn’t not be more lovely, I was told that they were sad we were leaving and this made me feel even confident that we had picked and amazing gem of a hotel in a idyllic French area. Will recommend to everyone – the perfect boutique Chic French experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in the Saint-Germain-des-Pres neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: thebigpill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose this hotel to be our home base for our second wedding anniversary. We had stayed at another hotel in their group, the Hotel des Grands Hommes, on our last trip and were extremely happy with them. We wanted to stay in Saint-Germain-des-Pres this time, so we decided to go with this new property, a four-star-rated hotel. Overall, we were once again very pleased with the quality of the room. Waiting for us when we arrived was a very nice bottle of champagne, with rose petals leading to the bed (very romantic!) and a note congratulating us on our anniversary. We stayed in a Deluxe room, the nicest of the non-suites. The size of the room was right in line with other hotels in Paris, particular in this neighborhood (read: on the smaller side, but big enough to be comfortable). The bed was the equivalent of an American 'king size' and was very comfortable. Highlights: 1) The shower was AMAZING! It is one of those 'rain' showers with the giant disc over your head, but it also had three powerful jets on the back wall to complete immerse you in powerful water flow! If you don't want to get your hair wet, you can use the jet in the front rather than the overhead rain shower head. Best shower I've ever experienced. 2) In-room iMAC, with free Wi-Fi access. This is immensely valuable for doing such things as looking up restaurants, making reservations, finding museum times, etc. the iMAC doubles as the TV and radio (for radio, I recommend the station FIP). 3) the in-room Nespresso coffee maker. If you've ever had Nespresso espresso, you'll know why I am so excited about this! 4) Free bottled water. This seems kind of innocuous when writing it out, but having that cold water in your room when you come back from walking around Paris all day was very, very nice. 5) Management. We had a couple of minor issues with some charges, but they were addressed quickly and fairly by the hotel management. 6) The staff made several good recommendations for restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel and even made a couple of reservations for us. A few minor issues: 1) There is no turn down service. My wife and I would come back after walking around all day and sometimes take a quick nap and a shower before going out in the evening. It would have been nice to come back to a freshly made bed and fresh towels. 2) The remote for the TV would sometimes be wonky and stop working altogether. We watched very little TV, though, so this was in no way a big deal. Other notes: 1) A survey was given for us to complete after our return, and a very quick reply was given by the deputy manager acknowledging our concerns, particularly about the turn down service. I feel confident that the hotel will have this service in the near future. 2) There is a very lovely looking pool and spa that my wife and I did not visit, but if you like a morning swim that's a nicety. 3) There is a very lovely little bar in the hotel as well; again, my wife and I did not visit so I cannot comment on the drinks or food, but it looks wonderful. Summary: A very nice little boutique hotel in a great neighborhood. My wife and I look forward to staying here again when we return for a future adventure in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “It's a nice little boutique hotel but a little overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Cheery66
Reviews.Content: My bf and I decided to go Paris for our short romantic getaway last week. We picked la belle Juliette due to the good reviews and attractive websites. Indeed she definitely did not disappoint us. But there are some cons. We booked ourselves 3 nights here. It's easy to find and surrounded by many good French restaurant n cafe. However for the price we were paying, I'm expecting a little bit more like: 1. non-defect shower room, the handle of tap in shower fell, it wasnt fixed/attached to the tap but we din raise it as it didn't seems to annoy us too much. 2: better amenities with hair conditioner. 3: We were also expecting no housekeeping when the do not disturb sign was hung at our door. I think if I were to visit Paris again, I'll try other luxury boutique hotels.

Reviews.Title: “La Belle Juliette delivered what most hotels cannot, couldn't be happier!”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy B
Reviews.Content: Our stay at La Belle Juliette was so good that I am writing my first ever public review! La Belle Juliette delivered what most hotels cannot, not one area lets them down, staff, fit out, cleanliness, feel, all my expectations were either met or seriously exceeded. I stayed with my Fiancee at La Belle Juliette in late August 2011, we were wowed from the start, when booking (direct through their website) I noted that it was my Fiancees Birthday during our stay. On arrival and check-in, we were warmly greeted and instantly told we had been upgraded from my original room booked and had 2 x complimentary glasses of champagne at the hotel bar, so far so good! Then, as we arrive at our room and opened the door they had left a lovely trail of petals scattered through the room to the bed with a note wishing my Fiancee Happy Birthday! You simply cannot ask for more. The whole feel of the hotel is exactly what you want from a boutique hotel, very elegant, very well appointed with fantastically friendly and polite staff. Every front of house member of staff we encountered was knowledgable, helpful and spoke perfect english. The rooms are lovely, the Italian shower option is the best, the underground lap pool with counter current for swimming is a great addition in such a limited space and the iMacs in the rooms are a very cool touch. Stay here without worry, they have nailed the boutique hotel brief. For us, it was a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: v0lc0m
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Paris and we were unsure of the best locations in town.... while trying not to sound smug, I think we found one of the top places available! The area is great, nice and Parisien, high end without being too pretentious. La Belle is on a lovely quiet street within walking distance of excellent cafes, restaurants, parks and metro stations. The hotel staff were very helpful, polite and eager to help, the bar, spa and terrace were lovely, fresh and quirky. Only down side is that the bar closes pretty early (we missed it every night!)... but I guess this is also a blessing as a late bar can = noisy hotel! The room we stayed in was excellent and it was just a standard one. Big bed, amazing shower and the iMac is a very nice touch, perfect for music, catching up on news and surfing the web for local ideas etc. Local restaurant Le Garcon was a recommendation by the hotel staff, right across the road and very good... combine that with St Germain which is a short walk away and you are spoilt for gastro-choice. When we go back to Paris I will struggle to find a reason not to stay at la Belle Juliette.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful slice of Paris life.”
Reviews.Author: neverturnright
Reviews.Content: Well appointed beautiful comfortable rooms and hotel. Wonderful attention to detail. Apple products a joy. Toilet separate from shower/bath room, love that. Breakfast OK but got a bit bored with it after a few days though some great cafes, restaurants and local shops close by. Le Bon Marche Department Store not far. Helpful attentive staff that were gorgeous with older family members. Great spot to get out and walk. Metros are 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in a very cosy street of 6th arrondissement”
Reviews.Author: Christine G
Reviews.Content: The standard rooms are quite small. For the next time I prefer to book a superior room. The decoration of the hotel is tasteful and attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay Ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gnomester
Reviews.Content: I rarely right reviews, but felt compelled to rave about this hotel. Having never travelled abroad, deciding where to stay was a decision I made with GREAT apprehension. Factors such as:notorious small rooms, ideal location, inadequate service/language barrier were all major considerations....oh, and this was to not only a lengthy trip, but also my honeymoon. So, I really wanted to ensure I delivered a highly memorable and enjoyable experience. And, upon arrival, all my concerns were alleved. This hotel was utterly terrific! - Booked a junior suite, received an upgrade...without even realizing until after the fact. - Bottle of champagne provided upon arrival (we don't drink, but it was a very nice touch, as the champagne flutes were perfect for sipping the complimentary bubbly water - it was a rather hot day). - Box of sweets also provided. - Check-in and hotel tour was very nicely executed...all while bags were brought up to our room. - The staff (Emily is worthy of honorable mention) was VERY nice, very accomodating and very helpful (recommendations, additional assistance - Nespresso and Water provided continuously throughout our 9 night stay). - The room was immaculate...and remained so throughout the trip. Now as for the hotel... - In short, it was incredibaly charming, adequately sized, beautifully appointed, chic, romantic...I can go on and on and on.... - The dual MACs in the suite were very nice (for those travelling from the U.S. may I recommend Comedy Channel and other online channel offerings to make you feel more "at-home"?) - The glass-doored mini-fridge acted as our own private cheese cave/patisserie cabinet throughout our gourmand travels. - The bathroom has an incredible shower (rainfall/italian style version) and huge tub. - For a more substantial dip, try out the basement pool, which might be the coolest feature I've ever had access within a hotel. Also, the Hamaan will warm the bones, if you are travelling during colder days. - The common areas are small-ish, but beautiful. The courtyard was terrific and used daily for our morning coffee ritual. Value: - Lastly, comparatively speaking, without even taking into account the unexpected upgrade, this hotel was very attractively priced - check comparative offerings via Kayak, Orbitz, Expedia for proof. In conclusion, our stay was awesome...and, on a personal note, I scored major points with the Mrs.!!!!! [Note: Pictures will be uploaded shortly]

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Laura P
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here to watch the Tour de France last month. The hotel is on a quite little street, about a 15 min walk from the centre of Paris. The staff were super friendly and spoke perfect French. They couldn't do enough for us and our room was absolutely beautiful. We had a standard double and it was stunning. The bar is very nice and the drinks are great too! It's a little bit more expensive than a bog standard Novotel or something but well worth little extra hike in price. If we went back to Paris again I think we'd definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “The devil is in the details.”
Reviews.Author: SunshineMiami_FL
Reviews.Content: We were looking to try a new hotel on the left bank after staying at one for several years. We know the area and were at first delighted to find La Belle Juliette. However our delight ended quickly. The web site entices the traveler with its attention to detail. But the real experience left much to be desired. This is a boutique hotel that has a hard time delivering. I deliberately chose a junior suite knowing that left bank hotel rooms are notoriously small. However the design of the rooms made one feel very small instead. The queen bed left little room to access the wall long closet which while it had reasonable space could not be easily used. In fact one of the doors to the closet did not open even though it could have. Seems as if the designer did not want to ruin the aesthetic. The side tables next to the bed were about 8" wide, large enough for nothing. The room(s) because in the suite there was a sitting room were equipped with large APPLE screens that could be used as TV, music, Movies (except there was no way to access any) and a computer. The rooms were wired for WIFI so at least we could use our Iphones in addition to the computer if we wished. The only problem was the drawers below the screen which contained the keyboard and mouse did not pull out far enough to access. Then there was the bathroom in the first room we had: It was a tub with a shower. However the tub free floated in its place and when one used the shower the water sprayed all over creating puddles on the floor. The hotel did move us to another junior suite where the tub was flush to the wall and thus didn't leak, however our new room was below a room with a free floating tub and the water from guest's use was soon seen oozing into our bathroom through the ceiling lights. The sink was free standing and there was no room to put any toiletries. The commode was in a completely different room right next to the door to the suite and about the size of utility closet. The hallways reminded me of a narrow train. We often found ourselves waiting quite awhile before anyone would answer the concierge phone. OK a boutique hotel..left bank Paris, I get it. I think next time I an going back to an older hotel with proven accommodations even if the rooms are small. I highly recommend others do the same with La Belle Juliette unless they are so haute fashion that design is all that counts. I know and have experienced where form and function have a beautiful marriage: La Belle Juliette does not have one.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel with phenomenal service”
Reviews.Author: Jackie H
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 nights in July, 2011. The hotel is nicely appointed, beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. We were particularly pleased with the service. The location is extremely convenient to a number of Metro stations, and a very nice neighbourhood with great restaurants and shopping as well. We would definitely stay there again! I reviewed numerous hotels on Trip Advisor before choosing this one, and was thoroughly pleased with the result.

Reviews.Title: “Small room - GREAT bed!"”
Reviews.Author: hirondelle11
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on all the previous reviews. We liked the relatively quiet location away from all the tourists. The hotel is new and everything is modern and clean. The room was very small; I don't know how people with a lot of luggage would manage. Fortunately we only had 2 small suitcases. The size of the room didn't really worry us since we didn't spend much time in it; Therefore the bed was big and very, very comfortable. The bathroom had a great shower. The windows open which is always a plus for us since we prefer to sleep without airconditioning. Lots of good little restaurants, bakeries and shops in the neighborhood. All in all a good stay, although I feel that it is a bit too pricey for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service”
Reviews.Author: huses
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night at La Belle Juliette en route to the South of France. It is in a great location and has very comfortable and well deocrated rooms. Breakfast - taken in the similarly intriguingly decorated room - was very good and set us well on the way to Gare Montparnasse. But what really set this hotel apart was the attention of the staff to service. From the handling of the booking on line, through to dealing with a few minor crises that befelled our short visit, nothing was too much trouble for the front desk. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a longer stay as a basis for exploring this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: jeeper333
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 just returned from Paris last evening and I could not wait to share my rave reviews of this hotel. Everyone should go here!!! From before check in to our sad check out, the staff, beauty of this boutique hotel and hip vibe exceeded my expectations beyond belief! We were already in Paris and traveling to Versailles overnight before checking in to la belle juliette. I called to ask if we could leave most of our luggage (6 bags!) the day before we checked in and they welcomed it graciously. Upon our arrival, our bags had been placed in one of our rooms for us. The hotel is new and EVERY room from the spa and lobby floors to our 3rd floor suite, deluxe twin and superior double is STUNNING (Yes, 3 rooms. They have a strict policy of 2 persons, adult or child, per room). Relaxing yet bold color combinations, super comfortable furniture, fully booted Macs in every room, rainfall showers...heaven. If you ask for a recommendation, you'll get a 2 page printed list of popular and "non touristy" places to see and dine! I could go on and on!! The breakfast was pricey, but the location is so conducive to walking that you can get to a lovely patisserie in a quick stroll. At this wonderful oasis, you truly get MORE than you pay for. It is 4 star for Europe, 5 star service for this international traveler!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: swisscheck
Reviews.Content: We benefitted from an introductory offer in this newly opened small hotel in Sain Germain des Prés at € 260/ per night which was good value for money. The standard room was tiny (17m2), the bathroom had a nice, large and powerful raindance shower.All rooms are equipped with their own safe and an iMac computer, allowing you to surf the Internet, listen to music or choose a film to watch. The hotel offers free broadband at a decent speed. Continental breakfast at € 20 offered fresh orange juice and a nice and crispy basket of breads and croissants. When we wanted some late night dinner after the opera, we could only choose from a cheese plate (one cheese, without bread) or cold meat, not exactely what you expect from a 4star hotel (I think the rating is overdone). I did not particularly like the violent colour schemes used, and my room did not look as bright as the one shown in their web page. All in all , good value for money and a short walk to St. Germain made it a good experience for a weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: juliet83
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was excellent - apart from one thing (which I'll come back to later...) It's been beautifully renovated and our room was decorated in lovely shades of pale blue and cream. The bathroom was great, with a good shower and a lovely deep bath - you don't always get both in Paris hotels. I loved the Apple tv/computer. Very easy to use and good screen resolution. (Watching the Tour de France on HD was amazing!) The area's great. Not too touristy with good local restaurants and a village feel, while having the bustle of St German about ten minutes walk away. We also tried using Velib bikes for for the first time - there's a 'station' of bikes just along the road - and loved cycling along the Seine and into the Marais. The ONE thing I'd fault this hotel on, though, was it's maid service. We left the hotel at 10 on Sunday morning to go cycling around Paris and came back at about 14.30. The room hadn't been cleaned and, just as we were settling down to watch a bit of TV and doze, we had a call asking if the maid could come and do the room. This meant we had to vacate it for 45 minutes or so which was a bit annoying. Apart from that though, I'd highly recommend this hotel. It's not cheap but it's probably on a par for what you'll pay for this standard of hotel in Paris. I'd definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - it doesn't get better than this!”
Reviews.Author: Birthdaytreat50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this wonderful hotel for my 50th Birthday. Having trawled through tons of hotels and checking out Trip Advisor for each one, we couldn't find anything negative written about La Belle Juliette. The photos looked stunning - almost too good to be true. When we arrived, we were welcomed by Timothy, who gave us a guided tour of the hotel and spa, together with a brief history of it's design, before showing us to our beautiful room. I was greeted by roses and chocolates for my birthday, and was overwhelmed by the lovely room. The attention to detail is incredible - they really have thought of everything. During our stay the staff were so helpful, and Danny was able to recommend exquisite restaurants, and kindly made reservations and booked tickets for us. It was lovely to be looked after so well, with such personal service - much better than the larger impersonal hotels. The Mac in the room was a real bonus, and the wi-fi incredibly fast and efficient. The bathtub was huge and the shower amazing... it's rare to find a room which you don't want to leave! Rue du Cherche Midi is a lovely quiet street, with a great little bistro opposite, and a fantastic tea room a few doors away, run by a lovely lady who doesn't speak English but makes you incredibly welcome! The Metro is just around the corner, just 4 minutes walk, which is a real bonus. We can't recommend this hotel highly enough - one of our friends is already hoping to stay there after hearing about our stay. Thank you to all the wonderful staff for making our stay such a treat. We will definitely be coming back.... and will probably stay in the same room (108) which is so romantic and just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: juco0501
Reviews.Content: I was obsessed with this hotel from the moment I saw the photos online. But upon check in, it just got better. It's in a great location that is close to all the sights but is a bit hidden on a fairly quiet local street. The BEST little bistrot is also across the street, run by an Asian man-- Le Petit Verdot, I think? No small detail was overlooked at the new hotel. The rooms are well decorated, and I will never have a shower again as amazing as that one! It's one of those showers with something like 5 showerheads that you can turn on from various angles. Beds were very comfortable, and supportive down pillows! They also supposedly had Nespresso machines in the closet, but my room unfortunately didn't have one, and I actually didn't need it. The wifi wasn't quite the best, as the connection came & went. The breakfast and lunch foods were fantastic-- I had the opportunity to try both while here, and in fact never wanted to leave. I only wish I had the chance to use the pool. I will be back! My new go-to in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: yl2309
Reviews.Content: Hotel La Belle Juliette is located in an excellent neighborhood-- close to the Bon Marche department store (good for shopping and the gourmet super market), and there are also many shops along Rue de Chere Midi (tons of restaurants/cafes, pharmacies, bakeries, convenience stores, etc.) The hotel is also a few minutes away from the Metro, which is a plus. Before my arrival, I had emailed the concierge inquiring about whether they provided hot water kettles in the room, and upon my arrival, I found out that they had gone out of their way to buy a hot water kettle-- which is truly a nice surprise and shows how much they were willing to accommodate to our needs. When we entered the room, they provided a complimentary bottle of champagne and a small box of chocolates. We stayed for over a week and are looking forward to returning to the hotel in the near future when we visit Paris again. I highly recommend Hotel La Belle Juliette!

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Paris”
Reviews.Author: intlwanderlust
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our one year anniversary in Paris. I used to live here and wanted my other half to experience this great city with me on our special day. I normally stay at Hotel St. Paul but they were more money for a smaller bed. And they are also a star rating less than Belle Juliette. So I tried Hotel La Belle Juliette based on reviews. The service was excellent. They even added roses to the room for our anniversary. The bed is big and extremely comfortable. The hotel is new as is all the furnishings. The two things I liked most about BJ were: the flat screen Mac w/ free wifi in the room and the shower! The shower is large enough for two people and has several nozzles for a car wash type of experience. We also tried the spa one morning and, while we loved the steam room, there's only 1 little bench in there, which the two of us pretty much occupied. I cannot imagine it holding more people comfortably. The pool is also pretty small and, again, would be awkward with more than 2 people. It's more of a mini-spa. I will return. I just hope it doesn't lose its charm.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay - will reccommend to friends”
Reviews.Author: carrom
Reviews.Content: The street is charming, full of nice shops and restaurants but relatively quiet and not too touristy. Hotel exterior is very discreet but once inside decor is fun and gets the balance right between kitch and classy. We stayed in the smallest room but it was adequate and the rate acceptable for Paris. Breakfast was not included and expensive at 20 euros pp if you just eat coffee and croissant so we just went out. The Spa has an indoor pool which is small but fun with coloured lights and air jets. Nice little ouside space for drinks. Staff are laid back and friendly, good atmosphere. Will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but really expensive for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: Dkasen
Reviews.Content: I know hotels in Paris are expensive so I was prepared to spend alot of money, but I don't think it was worth the money. It wasn't horrible. But, it wasn't wonderful either. The location was fine, but you do have to take a few metros to get to the major sites. The rooms were a little strange. We reserved two connecting rooms A's we were traveling with our two small children. What we got were two individual rooms that we had to prop open with luggage. There was a separate outside door to close off these two rooms. At least the door locks. I was disappointed that we had such a hard time reconfirming our reservations. I had sent several emails and never heard back. We were on a cruise and could not call so I had to have my cousin call for us to reconfirm. Added stress I did not need. Very tiny bars of soap that were not replaced everyday and housekeeping left two glasses of orange juice sitting for 3 days. A little strange. We would make a game out of it everyday to see if they would pick it up. Also, the refrigerator is not a true refrigerator, only cools beverages a little. I wish I had known this. We spent over $100 in cheeses and foie GRAS at la Grand Epicurie (the best gourmet food store I have ever been to). I thought we would have appetizers for a couple of days. The next day strange smells came from the box. Everything had spoiled. So much good food and money wasted. I said something to the girl downstairs and she said that they could hold something for us next time. I wish she would have said this to us before our shopping trip A's she was the one who had directed us to this store. Oh well, another experience.

Reviews.Title: “charmant”
Reviews.Author: agregoire
Reviews.Content: What a great stay! From the entrance to the room, it is like being on a different planet. Each floor has its own theme. We have stayed on the fourth floor: les causeries. The spirit in the room is perfectly matching this time of French history: when kings were governing the country, and (rich) ladies spending their time tchating with a cup of tea. The room is small, but very well arranged. A trendy Mac is stting in lieu of the TV and it is offering Internet (free) and .... Television. The room is nicely decorated with attention to details. Wow was our first word in entering the room. Details that matter: room is quiet, clean and the bed... well we had to leave unfortunately, but it was difficult to. The staff is really nice and helpful. Location is just great with plenty of French bistrots around. Don't miss this hotel, it is a gem

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: sia123
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I found this hotel to be clean, tidy and perfect for us. The rooms where small but we did expect this for Paris. The hotel has been recently refitted with a modern feel. The decor is gorgeous. My daughter loved the pool area downstairs. All the staff where so very helpful, nothing was too much trouble. They were wonderful! The locations is perfect, close to a wonderful outdoor market, beautiful boutiques and yummy bistro's. We could easily have spent 6 days exploring this little part of Paris. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Small by beautifully form”
Reviews.Author: dordor001
Reviews.Content: Although the reception and rooms are small, but the serivce was excellent, and the accomodation was bang on with all the facilities. Especially with the imac as computer / tv, saving us to bring laptop and charger. The hotel is new and fresh, loving the colour theme, while is a bit girlie, it wasn't over the top, even got my hunsband seal of approval! The staff showed us around the restaurant, the mini garden, and the spa, swimming pool in the basement, shame that we didnt bring our swimming suit, if not denfinity will use it! On top of that, the location was good and central, near St German which we can just walked any where. Can't wait to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was extremely beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Juha61
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very beautiful. Everything was clean and new. And the area of the hotel was very good. We also found out that best restaurants was at the hotels street. The only thing that we weren't so satisfied was the size of the room. It was quite small.

Reviews.Title: “A bijou of a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: KimPlusFriends
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is reasonably new to TripAdvisor, I had read enough about La Belle Juliette to risk booking two rooms for three nights over Easter 2011. It is an absolute gem. The simple reception layout and welcoming staff are the perfect greeting for the dishevelled and/or tired traveller (which I was). My friends were already in the lounge/bar area and I joined them immediately for a drink, which made me feel a million times better. The lounge is an extravagant pink and purple affair, as is the dining room. That said, they are both gorgeous and so different from the run of the mill beige affairs. The reception staff could not have been more charming or helpful. Everyone one of them went out of their way to assist with recommendations - not that common in Paris! The rooms are "small but perfectly formed". I only saw two (a standard and the next level up) and they were decorated differently to each other, but both lovely. The beds were comfy and the pillows perfect. We could not have wished for more other than, maybe, a bit more cupboard space and room for our cases, but I'd choose these rooms over big and soulless any day. The location of the hotel is excellent for St Germain and the Latin Quarter. It is a bit far from the metro if you are crazy enough to arrive with heavy luggage (which I did). There are plenty delicious places to eat within quick walking distance of the hotel. La Belle Juliette is the perfect hotel for an indulgent Parisienne break.

Reviews.Title: “Petite but Belle.....a fabulous location and choice!”
Reviews.Author: Moment-of-truth
Reviews.Content: This is a good quality boutique hotel located in the Latin quarter - a classy vibrant area, with good resaurants, cafes and shopping in proximity, in a typically French street of old building facades. Our room 208, was neat, clean and comfortable - though a bit small for Superior. The hotel seems relatively new so towels, bedding and other things in the room are in good condition. The bathroom and bedroom, while compact, sufficed given how little time we spent in the room and the stylish design made up for a feeling of luxury. Access to iron and ironing board very useful - provided on request by staff. The bed was comfortable - much nicer than some of the European hard beds we have encountered. Room temperature seemed on the warm side - but the airconditioning worked well and continued to work when the key was removed and we were out maintaining the temperature we had set it on. A couple of drawbacks were: the lovely French windows were permanently closed and could not be opened for fresh air or view on the street. There was a distinct lack of soap - there was plenty of douche gel - butonly one small bar provided for basin and NOT shower. Soap was not replaced. We have a preference for soap bars - we have noticed that some hotels in Europe simply provide the shower gel. Other than these minor points - rooms were provided with bathrobes and slippers. Clever use of cupboards for storage with good number of hangers. A clean, comfortable hotel in Paris in a good area - if you are happy not to be in immediate proximity of the Champs d'Elysee. Good access to all key sites - though given the size of the city recommend the Red Tourist bus - hoping on and off for convenient travel around the city from this location. Metro -Vaneau located nearby - but the street signage did not correspond to the names we found on google making this a bit complex to find our way from the Metro for the first time. When in Paris definitely go to Terres de Truffes restaurant - if you like truffles this is the pace to go. We had a wonderful meal. Staff at the hotel organised taxi's for us and happily made the reservations. Paris - a great city, a good neat hotel choice, with a slightly modern twist, and a wonderful weekend. We did not have breakfast at the hotel - but chose to sit at a street side cafe - enjoying hot chocolats and croissants - ... and the place on the corner had fresh croissants and was as good as I recalled this breakfast experience from previous trip, some years ago. We sat people watching and enjoying breakfast at the pavement table - bon! so we can't comment on the meals here - surrounded by too many other options conveniently located to eat in. A key benefit of La Belle Juliette was the free wifi access and keyboard & terminal in each room. This allowed us to do some quick searching and make our dinner arrangements. Hotel staff friendly and helpful in facilitating bookings and ordering taxis. Many thanks, a Happy Australian Couple

Reviews.Title: “Very pretty & charming”
Reviews.Author: martaiba
Reviews.Content: I just stayed 11 nights at La Belle Juliette and I highly recommended. Love the street, Cherche Midi, very quiet and charming; loved my very chic room very tastefully decorated in a mix of old and new. I asked the concierge for some vases as I was about to go and buy flowers for my room, when I got back i had a beautiful bouquet of roses by my bedside table! The staff is very nice and professional and gave me excellent tips on restaurants. Although the spa looked very nice I didn't have time to check it out. If you are looking for a hidden gem, go to La Belle Juliette.

Reviews.Title: “exquisite design boutique”
Reviews.Author: CA_Jayhawk
Reviews.Content: We wanted a romantic paris get-away – this hotel was EXACTLY what we were looking for. A perfect blend of Parisian tradition and contemporary style. Hotel website photos can be quite misleading, but in this case, it really is as good as it looks. The materials and finishes hold up – right down to the details. In my old age I've become somewhat of a hotel snob, and at the Belle Juliette, I couldn't stop smiling. We will absolutely stay here again when we return to Paris. We'd booked a superior room (or was it deluxe?). When we arrived, we were shown a junior suite as well, and we chose to upgrade to that (room 307). It has a small entry/sitting room in addition to the bedroom. We probably could have gotten by with the smaller room, but the extra space gave us some valuable breathing space. It also had a combination shower/tub, which had some appeal. If Paris itself wasn't so charming, we would have spent more time at the hotel and it's environs. The spa has a small pool/hot tub that looked beautiful. I saw the photo on the web, but assumed it was only for spa patrons. Not so. Any hotel guest can use it. There's also a really pleasant-looking outdoor patio that we never made use of. The staff seemed genuinely dismayed that we didn't take advantage of the pool. Although this neighborhood isn't "right next to everything", we liked it's quiet nature. There are no tourist busses or crowds – but it's a quick taxi wherever you want to go. There are several charming bars and restaurants within a block or two and we liked the ones we tried. If you go across the street to "Midi Vins", they have a breakfast dish that will melt your heart. It has a base of chopped mushrooms, with a poached egg over it and a cream sauce with sea salt. It sounds somewhat basic, but really, delicious. There's also an intriguing children's shop called "Serendipity" nearby - worth a stop if you have little ones. I had read a few reviews of smaller hotels where people complained about street noise. There is some noise here in the early morning hours, and every room faces the street. It was particularly bad one day, and better on the rest. Honestly, I imagine it's fairly similar wherever you go. Ultimately, it didn't diminish our experience. The staff was helpful, personable and charming. They do have free internet (which I really appreciate). Instead of TVs, they have Apple iMacs, which work great (but they don't play US-format DVDs). I really can't recommend this hotel enough. I hope you enjoy it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!!”
Reviews.Author: sherry077
Reviews.Content: This is probably going to be my favourite place to stay in Paris. The hotel is fairly new, having only opened in January 2011. Everything looks fresh and new indeed. My room was on the 2nd floor and despite the hotel's fantastically central location, there was hardly any noise. The hotel is on a parallel one way street with not that much traffic. I was in Paris for business, but even for tourists it's a perfect base to explore Paris. Several metro stations are walking distance and it's in a gorgeous area with lovely bistros, shops, etc. The room was gorgeous. Not very big, but I felt more than compensated by the lovely design and the super comfy bed. The only drawback in my view was the toilet which was separate from the bath and quite small. The room also had an iMac which served as a TV and offered free Internet. Free Wifi is available in the entire hotel which is great. But what really made La Belle Juliette stand out for me was the friendliness of the staff. Very professional in every way. After the check-in I was taken on a quick tour through the hotel's reception area, lovely courtyard terrace, the spa and then accompanied to my room where the nice young gentleman explained where I could find everything, how to use the fancy shower, etc. He also helped us when we were looking to find a place for dinner. Excellent service without being cheesy or too imposing. 5 stars from me! Only suggestion to the hotel: change the logo. Using the initials BJ will probably make a few people grin...

Reviews.Title: “Sensational service and accommodation in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: nicholas_harris
Reviews.Content: Would go back there in a heartbeat. Great location, exceptional service oriented staff, exquisite breakfast. Will use the swimming pool and spa service next time.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is just great”
Reviews.Author: stefmar75
Reviews.Content: Extremely clean, service excellent, Nespresso machine in the room included in the price, quite room, and the breakfast was faboulous. I will absolutely reccomended it.

Reviews.Title: “Best ever.”
Reviews.Author: LittleMissWanderlust
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and I cannot praise La Belle Juliette enough; we all enjoyed our stay very much. The best part was the staff, who went completely out of their way, 24 hours a day, to make our stay in Paris pleasurable and easy, setting up reservations, accommodating friends who arrived late, and helping us with Paris nightlife. The concierge service at La Belle was the best I've experienced in Europe, by far. I have ONE minor comment, and that is with respect to the bathroom- our room had only curtains separating the bath area, so the entire room would become very humid when showering and the toilet was in a separate small "closet-like" room. This did not detract from our stay at all- we just opened the window when showering, but that may present an issue in the winter. I will definitely return (hopefully soon!).

Reviews.Title: “this hotel emphasizes the "Paris-feel"...”
Reviews.Author: FKR12345
Reviews.Content: To me, Paris is about romance, elegance and decadence and La Belle Juliette embodies all of these. The interior is beautiful. The size is relatively small. A typical boutique hotel. Service is good. Staff takes the time to make sure you are properly attended to. Rooms are relatively small but charming. Beds are very good. The fact that opening a window at night is not really possible because of the noise is a minor setback but not unusual for Paris and has little to do with the hotel. The availability of multi-media in the rooms is a definite plus. Location in the 6th: main attractions not too far away whilst enjoying the tranquility of a neighbourhood. Boutique shops all around. To recap: I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to experience the "Paris-feel"...

Reviews.Title: “Just go and stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yk-Ifi
Reviews.Content: Room : a bit small and low ceiling but one of the best and largest you can find in Paris, excellent colours, excellent bed, very good mini refrigerator (not for ice, but you can get free from the hotel bar), very nice bathroom with large bathtube (toilet separated at an isolated small room, i find that good for...odvious reasons... ). Cleanliness : excellent, every day. Stuff : excellent reception service, very friendly, ready to help you for everything. Location : quiet and safe street. Also very near at the hotel, 2-5minutes on foot, you will find many and nice caffes, bakeries, mini markets (Carrefour 3min), brasseries and generally many shops. Transportation : quiet hot spot, on foot , metro Vaneau 4min, metro SevresBabylon 8min, piazza taxi 6min. Internet : free, very quick and generally amazing! internet and TV are at a plasma Apple 26' screen. Hotel Bar : very cozy and excellent decorated with two fire-places, classic music, and trendy colours, but most nights empty of people. Restaurant : we where there 3-7 March, no restaurant, but they told us that the next day they would start it. Breakfast : DONT! no buffet, very-very poor and too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MurrayDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. Hotel is still very quiet - it felt like we were the only people there most of the time (which we liked). The public areas are a little enthusiastically designed for my taste and it can all feel a bit try-hard but the rooms are large (for Paris), elegant and clean with black-out shutters, macs, free wi-fi, Nespresso machine and very comfortable beds. The staff are charming and very helpful - they might be a bit more rushed as the hotel gets busier. There are still a few teething problems to be ironed out - the Spa was closed when we were there and were were woken by the fire alarm on our first morning - but it's a pleasant place to stay and the area is great - a short stroll to Au Bon Marche and the shops of Rue Dragon, Rue de Bac etc. And it's on the same street as Mamie Gateaux, which is reason enough to stay there. Enjoy.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel La Belle Juliette
HotelInfo.Address: 92 rue du Cherche Midi, 75006 Paris, France
